intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius melanocalpis, commonly known as the black-eyed yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to moderately dry conditions. Its flowers are yellow with a dark center, and the leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and often hairy. It is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
